author: Mohammed Iqbal
text:
A Special CBI Court here on Saturday summoned former Telecom Minister Dayanidhi Maran, his brother Kalanithi Maran and four others as accused in the Aircel-Maxis deal-related money laundering case. The accused were charge-sheeted by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

The ED had claimed that there were money transactions allegedly showing that South Asia FM Limited (SAFL) and two firms, SAFL and Sun Direct TV Private Ltd. (SDTPL), had received Rs.742.58 crore as proceeds of crime from Mauritius-based firms in the Aircel-Maxis deal. SAFL was allegedly controlled by co-accused Kalanithi Maran.

The Central Bureau of Investigation had also charge-sheeted the Maran brothers, two Malaysian nationals and four companies in the case in August 2014.

All the accused have denied the charges levelled against them by the investigating agencies.
title: Enough material to charge Marans: court
